TestCase.Title: Test case TLS_A2_FR_07
TestCase.Purpose: This test verifies that the Truncated-HMAC extension is not offered and cannot be used in a connection.
TestCase.Precondition: The test TLS server is waiting for incoming TLS connections on [URL].

Command.Text: The tester causes the DUT to connect to the TLS server on [URL].

ExpectedResult.Text: The TLS server receives a ClientHello handshake message from the DUT.
The TLS ClientHello does not offer the Truncated-HMAC extension.

Command.Text: The TLS server answers the DUT choosing a TLS version and a cipher suite that is contained in the ClientHello.

TestStep.Description: The TLS server supplies the certificate chain [CERT_DEFAULT].
The server sends a CertificateRequest to the DUT.
The server selects the Truncated-HMAC extension despite it was not offered.
No further extensions are supplied by the server.

ExpectedResult.Text: The client supplies a valid client certificate and a correct CertificateVerify message.
The DUT rejects the connection with a "unsupported_extension" alert or another suitable error description.
